cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then expected to arc northeast across AL-GA into the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch/warning confined to northern Gulf Coast – Intracoastal City LA eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area (Intracoastal City LA to Okaloosa/Walton County line FL, incl. Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and metro New Orleans)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL-western FL Panhandle) first, then inland AL-GA-SC-NC coastlines by late weekend/early next week
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; sporadic gusts 25–35 kt possible as the remnant center passes inland nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (≤1 ft above ground) possible with onshore flow during high tide; significant surge (>3 ft) not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches, locally 6 inches possible Sunday night–Monday, producing ponding and localized flash flooding on terminal roadways and yards.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands; brief lightning-halted cargo operations.
